statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Virginia Military 135, Lees McRae 75
article.story: LEXINGTON, Va. (AP) -- Reggie Williams scored 31 and VMI set a new school record for the most 3-pointers in a game with 22 as the Keydets beat Lees-McRae 135-75 Wednesday night. It was just the latest record-breaking game for VMI (4-7), who already has broken about 30 records this season thanks in part to its high-intensity offense. It was the sixth 30-point game for Williams, who also finished with 10 assists. The Keydets hit six 3-pointers over a five-minute, 29-7 run that put VMI up 115-63 with 8:28 left to play. VMI then held Lees-McRae (3-4) to 5 points over the last five minutes Aaron Duggar's 3-pointer tied it with 17:01 remaining in the first half, but the Keydets answered with a 23-4 run, including five 3-pointers, that made it 31-12 with 10:39 to go before the break. Another 19-4 run put VMI up 70-38 at halftime. Travis Holmes his 6 of 11 3-pointers to finish with 28 points for the Keydets. Matt Murrer scored 25, and Chavis Holmes also had six from 3-point range for 21. Willie Bell added 15. Duggar had five 3-pointers to lead Lees-McRae with 25 points. Henry Williams had 17, and D.J. Menifee added 10. The Keydets outscored Lees-McRae 52-30 in the paint and used a 54-29 rebounding advantage to outscore the Bobcats 35-8 in second-chance points. Neither team scored on a fast break.
